meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the measurement of time
meanings.sent1: The chronographic clock displayed the exact time in big numbers.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a chronographic tool to track the passage of time during the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The chronographic watch was so precise that it even counted the seconds in a blink.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a chronographic camera, capturing every moment in perfect detail.
meanings.sent5: The chronographic calendar was so accurate that it never missed a single day.

meanings.definition: A device or instrument used for measuring or recording time intervals
meanings.sent1: The chronographic stopwatch helped the coach time the runners accurately.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an ancient chronographic sundial used by early civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The chronographic timer beeped loudly, signaling the end of the cooking time.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a chronographic metronome, beating steadily in rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The chronographic hourglass was a beautiful piece of art, measuring time in a unique way.
